paper_dropbox_requests.title: IEEE VIS 2022 Upload Request for {UID}
paper_dropbox_requests.description: Please upload all the material for {UID} that has been requested.

email_template_test.subject: Some Test Mail for Paper {UID}
email_template_test.body_text: We regret to inform you that your request for paper {Title} has not been granted
email_template_test.body_html:
Hello

We regret to inform you that your request for paper {Title} has not been granted

upload_request_full_short.subject: IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request
upload_request_full_short.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2023 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.
As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8.  

We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2023 lasts until Friday, September 8.  One author/presenter for each work is required to attend the conference in person, and to register at the rates outlined on http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration.

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.

For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system:

{PMU Upload Link}

1. Video Preview Submission. Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews. The deadline for the video preview is August 22.

2. Paper Presentation Video Recording. All VIS presentations should be accompanied by a recording of the presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting a recording of the paper presentation. Detailed instructions, including technical requirements for your presentation materials, are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via the Presentation Material Upload system. The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

3. Representative Image. As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption file, for use on the virtual website. The same paper specific Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the representative image and caption. Deadline is September 8.

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

4. Author Information Form. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed to help the organizing committee plan the program and improve the publication process in the future. Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76 Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form.  Deadline for completing the form is September 8.

5. Copyright Release. Finally, for papers that will be published in IEEE TVCG or on IEEE Xplore.  Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information.

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu
upload_request_full_short.body_html:
IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request

https://ieeevis.org/

Dear {Contributor(s)},

Congratulations once again on the acceptance to VIS 2023 of your paper with the unique submission ID {UID}, entitled “{Title}”.

As per the instructions you received in the final acceptance email, the final camera ready papers and supplemental materials are to be uploaded via the PCS submission system by August 8.

We also kindly remind you that the early registration period for IEEE VIS 2023 lasts until Friday, September 8. One author/presenter for each work is required to attend the conference in person, and to register at the rates outlined on: https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration.

This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items required (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors

For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system:

{PMU Upload Link}

  1. Video Preview Submission

    Please upload your mandatory 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}.

    Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews.

    The deadline for the video preview is August 22.

  2. Paper Presentation Video Recording

    All VIS papers should be accompanied by a recording of the paper presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting a recording of the paper presentation.

    Detailed instructions regarding these recordings are available here: https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide.

    The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via the Presentation Material Upload system.

    The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 8.

  3. Representative Image

    As described in the talk recording guide (https://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is also required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use on the virtual website. The same Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the image and caption.

    The deadline is September 8.

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

  1. Author Information Form

    Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed to help the organizing committee plan the program and improve the publication process in the future. Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76

    Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form. The deadline for completing the form is September 8.

  2. Copyright Release

    Finally, for papers that will be published in IEEE TVCG or on IEEE Xplore. Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information.

Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. All deadlines are at 11:59pm (23:59) Anywhere on Earth (AoE). If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs

Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu

upload_request_associated_event_workshop.subject: IEEE VIS 2023 Upload Request
upload_request_associated_event_workshop.body_text:
Dear {Contributor(s)} 
Congratulations once again on the acceptance of your {Event} presentation. This email provides instructions for uploading materials to the conference.  For administrative purposes, we have assigned you a unique submission ID, {UID}, for your paper “{Title}”.
We kindly remind you that one author/presenter for each work is required to attend the conference in person, and to register at the rates outlined on http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/registration/conference-registration. 
This email contains instructions concerning the upload of additional submission items (video preview, pre-recorded talk, etc.) as well as some additional information needed for publication. Five points that require your action are listed below, please read carefully and follow the links to finalize your submission. Detailed information and instructions regarding the preparation of all items listed are available here, although some items may vary for your specific event: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/final-information-paper-authors.
For the first three points, please use the following link to upload the requested material via our Presentation Material Upload system: 
{PMU Upload Link}


1. Video Preview Submission [Recommended]. Please upload your optional 25-second video preview and subtitle file via the provided Presentation Material Upload link. The link is specific for material relating to your paper with submission ID {UID}. Instructions regarding the creation of the video preview are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/fast-forward-and-video-previews. 
For associated events and workshops the video preview is optional but recommended. The deadline for the video preview is September 22.

2. Paper Presentation Video Recording [Recommended]. Authors are recommended to prepare and submit a recording of their paper presentation. Authors will give their talks in person at the conference, in addition to submitting the recording of the paper presentation. Detailed instructions, including technical requirements for your presentation materials, are available here: http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide. For associated events and workshops the video recording is optional but recommended. The {Event} chairs will provide you event-specific instructions regarding talk length and format.  The video recording of your presentation, as well as mandatory subtitles, for your paper with submission ID {UID} should also be uploaded via the Presentation Material Upload system. The deadline for the presentation video recording is September 22.

3. Representative Image [Required]. As described in the talk recording guide (http://ieeevis.org/year/2023/info/presenter-information/talk-recording-guide), it is required for authors to submit a representative image, with a brief caption, for use on the virtual website. The same paper specific Presentation Material Upload link as above should be used for uploading the representative image and caption. Deadline is September 22.

After uploading a file, we perform various initial checks automatically. If any errors are reported, you must fix the raised issues before the respective deadline. We also encourage you to strongly consider any warnings that might be displayed.

4. Author Information Form [Required]. Additional information regarding your paper presentation and publication is needed to help the organizing committee plan the program and improve the publication process in the future.
Please visit this link and complete the corresponding form: https://forms.gle/ueHiYLCtgExw4in76 
Please use your submission ID: {UID} when filling in the form.  Deadline for completing the form is September 22.

5. Copyright Release [Conditional]. Finally, if your submission is intended to be published in IEEE Xplore, a copyright release is required.  Please expect an email after you complete your final manuscript submission with additional instructions on how to complete this information. 
Please carefully go through and complete the list of tasks by the above given deadlines. If you have any questions don’t hesitate to contact the publications chairs at publications@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2023 Publications Chairs
Arvind Satyanarayan, Katerina Vrotsou, and Zhicheng Liu

test_attendee_info.subject: IEEE VIS 2023 Content Login [Test]
test_attendee_info.body_text:
Dear {name},

This is a test email for the content webssite at VIS 2023. You are receiving this email as member of the Organizing Comittee. This email contains your login information for the content website: https://content.ieeevis.org/year/2023/index.html 

Username: {email}
Password: {password}

In this site, you can browse the schedule for the in-person conference happening in Melbourne, Australia. The website also contains digital content for papers: including fast forwards and prerecorded presentations for papers.

As an OC member we need your help proofing the website for any ommissions or errors. Please note that missing videos could be a result of tardy uploads, if this is not the case please let us know.


We have also provided a Discord server for VIS 2023 to help to connect online and on-site attendees, but please note that we will not monitor it for questions.

For social interaction you can use Discord: {discord_invite_url}


If you have any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs: tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2022 Tech Chairs
Johannes Knittel, Kadek Satriadi, John Thompson, John Wenskovitch

Password: {password}

In this site, you can browse the schedule for the in-person conference happening in Melbourne, Australia. The website also contains digital content for papers: including fast forwards and prerecorded presentations for papers.

As an OC member we need your help proofing the website for any ommissions or errors. Please note that missing videos could be a result of tardy uploads, if this is not the case please let us know.

We have also provided a Discord server for VIS 2023 to help to connect online and on-site attendees, but please note that we will not monitor it for questions.

For social interaction you can use Discord: {discord_invite_url}

If you have any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs: tech@ieeevis.org.

Best regards,

IEEE VIS 2023 Tech Chairs

Johannes Knittel, Kadek Satriadi, John Thompson, and John Wenskovitch

attendee_info.subject: Welcome to IEEE VIS 2023
attendee_info.body_text:
Dear {name},
Thank you for registering for VIS 2023! We are excited to welcome you to the IEEE VIS 2023 Conference in Melbourne, Australia. One of the major changes this year is that the conference is once again an on-site-first conference. To assist with the conference experience, we provide detailed schedules, videos, and papers on our web-based content site.
This email contains your login information for the content site: https://content.ieeevis.org/year/2023/index.html 
Username: {email}
Password: {password}
In addition to the on-site activities, you are invited to Discord for informal discussions and exchange.
Discord Invite: {discord_invite_url}
## Additional information on travel from Melbourne Airport to City Centre and payments
The General Chairs have received a few questions about credit card use and travel between the airport and Melbourne city centre and have asked to include a note here.  
Melbourne does not have a train connection between the airport and the city. Transfer to the city centre is via SkyBus (https://www.skybus.com.au/melbourne-city-express/), a bus service that runs frequently 24-hours, 7 days a week.  SkyBus is well signposted in the airport.  Tickets can be purchased online, via the app, or at e-kiosks outside the terminal.  The bus takes you to Southern Cross train station in the city centre.  Travel by tram within the city centre is free within the Free Tram Zone (https://www.ptv.vic.gov.au/assets/PDFs/Maps/Network-maps/5b4a3efe80/PTV-Free-Tram-Zone-Map.pdf), though note that the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition tram stop is just outside the free zone.  More information on Melbourne can be found on the VIS 2023 Destination webpage (https://www.ieeevis.org/year/2023/destination).
Credit cards can be used everywhere throughout Melbourne for payment.  VISA and Mastercard are widely accepted, though Amex is not available in many places.  Cash in Australian dollars can be withdrawn from ATMs for debit cards, though cash is not necessary and many Melbournians don’t carry cash.
If you have any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to email the Tech chairs:
tech@ieeevis.org.
 
Best regards,
IEEE VIS 2023 Tech Chairs
Johannes Knittel, Kadek Satriadi, John Thompson, John Wenskovitch
